citation.name: Am. J. Hum. Genet.
citation.title: Mutations in ASPH cause facial dysmorphism, lens dislocation, anterior-segment abnormalities, and spontaneous filtering blebs, or Traboulsi syndrome.

comment.text: Isoform 1: specifically hydroxylates an Asp or Asn residue in certain epidermal growth factor-like (EGF) domains of a number of proteins.

Isoform 8: membrane-bound Ca(2+)-sensing protein, which is a structural component of the ER-plasma membrane junctions. Isoform 8 regulates the activity of Ca(+2) released-activated Ca(+2) (CRAC) channels in T-cells.
Peptide L-aspartate + 2-oxoglutarate + O(2) = peptide 3-hydroxy-L-aspartate + succinate + CO(2).
Monomer (By similarity). Isoform 8 interacts with ORAI1 and STIM1. Isoform 4 interacts with CASQ2.

isoform.name: Junctin-1
Cardiac junctin
isoform.text: Contains a N-linked (GlcNAc...) asparagine at position 64.

comment.text: Comment: 3 functionally distinct proteins are produced by alternative splicing: Aspartyl/asparaginyl beta-hydroxylase, Junctin and Junctate. Additional isoforms are produced by alternative splicing.
Isoform 1 is detected in all tissues tested. Isoform 8 is mainly expressed in pancreas, heart, brain, kidney and liver. Isoform 8 is expressed in kidney (at protein level).

disease.name: Facial dysmorphism, lens dislocation, anterior segment abnormalities, and spontaneous filtering blebs
disease.description: A syndrome characterized by dislocated crystalline lenses and anterior segment abnormalities in association with a distinctive facies involving flat cheeks and a beaked nose. Some affected individuals develop highly unusual non-traumatic conjunctival cysts (filtering blebs).

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the aspartyl/asparaginyl beta-hydroxylase family.

feature.description: Helical; Signal-anchor for type II membrane protein
In isoform 3, isoform 4, isoform 5, isoform 8, isoform 9 and isoform 10.

Increase in cytoplasmic Ca(2+) via activation of endogenous CRAC channels.
